content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a stack of three whole notes in treble clef. The pitches are A-flat 4, C5, E-flat 5.
The figure presents a stack of three whole notes in treble clef. The pitches are A-flat 4, C-flat 5, E-flat 5.
The figure presents a stack of three whole notes in treble clef. The pitches are A-flat 4, C-flat 5, E-double flat 5.
The figure presents a stack of three whole notes in treble clef. The pitches are A-flat 4, C5, E5.

content.answer: The figure presents a stack of three whole notes in treble clef. The pitches are A-flat 4, C-flat 5, E-double flat 5.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

topic.text: 3.1: Triad and Chord Qualities (M, m, d, A)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
